class.name: GameLog
class.brief_description: Application-wide logger for general purpose. Use it to write messages to the game's debug console. For development-only logs, prefer Godot's built-in functions such as push_error(), push_warning(), print(), and print_rich().
class.description:
Provides a simple, application-wide logging system with severity levels and a signal that emits whenever a new log line is produced.
GameLog is available as an Engine singleton named "GameLog", so you can access the same instance from anywhere in scripts. For example, in GDScript:
[codeblock] GameLog.info("Scenario initialized") GameLog.warning("Low FPS detected") GameLog.error("Failed to load route") GameLog.debug("Loaded config in %s ms" % load_time) [/codeblock]
Use this logger to output information relevant to the game runtime and to subscribe to log updates. For ad-hoc development diagnostics or editor-time messages, use Godot's built-in logging helpers (push_error, push_warning, print, print_rich).

method.name: debug
method.description: Logs a message at DEBUG level. See [enum GameLog.LogLevel]. [codeblock] GameLog.debug("Loaded config in %s ms" % load_time) [/codeblock]

method.name: error
method.description: Logs a message at ERROR level. See [enum GameLog.LogLevel]. [codeblock] GameLog.error("Failed to load route: %s" % err) [/codeblock]

method.name: info
method.description: Logs a message at INFO level. See [enum GameLog.LogLevel]. [codeblock] GameLog.info("Scenario initialized") [/codeblock]

method.name: log
method.description: Logs a message at the specified level. [codeblock] GameLog.log(GameLog.LogLevel.WARNING, "Low FPS detected") [/codeblock]

method.name: warning
method.description: Logs a message at WARNING level. See [enum GameLog.LogLevel]. [codeblock] GameLog.warning("Battery voltage low") [/codeblock]

signal.name: log_updated
signal.description: Emitted whenever a new log message is produced.
